  +
'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[public company|public corporation]], specializing in [[Internet search]] and [[online advertising]]. The company is based in [[Mountain View, California]], and has 13,748 full-time employees (as of [[June 30]] [[2007]]).<ref>"[http://www.google.com/press/pressrel/revenues_q207.html Google Announces Second Quarter 2007 Results]." July 19, 2007. Retrieved on [[August 22]], [[2007]].</ref> Google's mission statement is, "to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful."<ref>"[http://www.google.com/corporate/ Google Corporate Information: Company Overview]." ''Google.'' Retrieved on [[January 6]], [[2007]].</ref> Google's corporate philosophy includes statements such as "Don't be evil", and "Work should be challenging and the challenge should be fun", illustrating a somewhat relaxed corporate culture.
Google was co-founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while they were students at [[Stanford University]] and the company was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 7]], [[1998]]. Google's [[initial public offering]] took place on [[August 19]], [[2004]], raising [[United States Dollar|$]]1.67 billion, making it worth $23 billion. Through a series of new product developments, acquisitions and partnerships, the company has expanded its initial search and advertising business into other areas, including web-based [[email]], online mapping, office productivity, and video sharing, among others.
Google was co-founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while they were students at [[Stanford University]] and the company was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 7]], [[1998]]. Google's [[initial public offering]] took place on [[August 19]], [[2004]], raising [[United States Dollar|$]]1.67 billion, making it worth $23 billion. Through a series of new product developments, acquisitions and partnerships, the company has expanded its initial search and advertising business into other areas, including web-based [[email]], online mapping, office productivity, and video sharing, among others.
